intro: Oxytropis candicans, commonly known as the golden globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant has small, trifoliate leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, and is adapted to arid environments. Oxytropis candicans is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
